title: Jordan's totient function
summary: Let k {\displaystyle k} be a positive integer. In number theory, the Jordan's totient function J k ( n ) {\displaystyle J_{k}(n)} of a positive integer n {\displaystyle n} equals the number of k {\displaystyle k} -tuples of positive integers that are less than or equal to n {\displaystyle n} and that together with n {\displaystyle n} form a coprime set of k + 1 {\displaystyle k+1} integers.
